pullRequest.body:
Two simple lemmas, `smul_ite_zero`, and `ite_smul_zero`.
Also delete `Finset.sum_univ_ite` since it is now provable by `simp` thanks to these.

Rename and turn around the following to match the direction that `simp` goes in:
* `ite_mul_zero_left` → `ite_zero_mul`
* `ite_mul_zero_right` → `mul_ite_zero`
* `ite_and_mul_zero` → `ite_zero_mul_ite_zero`

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body: bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge
:-1: Rejected by label
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7089138028/job/19293199791)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7089138028/job/19293199086)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7089138028/job/19293200436)
Shouldn't we have `b = 1` for this to be "boole"?
Yeah sorry, I got confused because we can't actually state `smul_boole` (`a • 1` doesn't simplify to anything).
Are you deleting this lemma on purpose?
Yes, this is an artifact of the port and is now provable by simp.
nit: should `P` be upper case?
Depends which file you ask! I would say no here just because `R` is a close letter used for an algebraic structure.
Fair
Why is the smul version `simp` but not the `mul` version? While it's not a blocker, this creates non-confluence depending on whether `smul_eq_mul` fires first.
That's because `ite_mul` is simp. So it doesn't create non-confluence, no, merely a lack of parallelism.
Arguably the lack of `simp` on `ite_smul` is a confluence issue, but I guess that's probably out of scope here.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `(if P then 1 else 0) • a`
